description: Schema for ArangoDB Foxx service manifests

configuration.description: An object defining the configuration options this service requires.

description.description: A human-readable description of the option.

type.description: The type of value expected for this option.

default.description: The default value for this option in plain JSON. Can be omitted to provide no default value.

required.description: Whether the service can not function without this option. Defaults to true unless a default value is provided.

defaultDocument.description: If specified, the / (root) route of the service will automatically redirect to the given relative path, e.g. "index.html".

dependencies.description: The dependencies this service uses, i.e. which APIs its dependencies need to be compatible with.

oneOf.description: The semantic version ranges of the API the service expects.

name.description: Name of the API the service expects.

version.description: The semantic version ranges of the API the service expects.

description.description: A description of how the API is used or why it is needed.

required.description: Whether the service can not function without this dependency.

multiple.description: Whether the dependency can be specified more than once.

provides.description: The dependencies this provides, i.e. which APIs it claims to be compatible with.

additionalProperties.description: The semantic version ranges of the API the service implements.

engines.description: An object indicating the semantic version ranges of ArangoDB (or compatible environments) the service will be compatible with.

files.description: An object defining file assets served by this service.

oneOf.description: Relative path of the file or folder within the service.

path.description: Relative path of the file or folder within the service.

gzip.description: If set to true the file will be served with gzip-encoding if supported by the client. This can be useful when serving text files like client-side JavaScript, CSS or HTML.

type.description: The MIME content type of the file. Defaults to an intelligent guess based on the filename's extension.

lib.description: The relative path to the Foxx JavaScript files in the service, e.g. "lib". Defaults to the folder containing this manifest.

main.description: The relative path to the main entry point of this service (relative to lib), e.g. "index.js".

scripts.description: An object defining named scripts provided by this service, which can either be used directly or as queued jobs by other services.

additionalProperties.description: Path of the script (relative to lib), e.g. "scripts/setup.js".

tests.description: A path/pattern or list of paths/patterns of JavaScript tests provided for this service.

items.description: A single path/pattern of JavaScript tests provided for this service.

author.description: The full name of the author of the service (i.e. you). This will be shown in the web interface.

contributors.description: A list of names of people that have contributed to the development of the service in some way. This will be shown in the web interface.

items.description: Human-readable representation of the contributor, e.g. their name.

description.description: A human-readable description of the service. This will be shown in the web interface.

keywords.description: A list of keywords that help categorize this service. This is used by the Foxx Store installers to organize services.

items.description: A keyword relevant to the service.

license.description: A string identifying the license under which the service is published, ideally in the form of an SPDX license identifier. This will be shown in the web interface.

name.description: The name of the Foxx service. This will be shown in the web interface.

thumbnail.description: The filename of a thumbnail that will be used alongside the service in the web interface. This should be a JPEG or PNG image that looks good at sizes 50x50 and 160x160.

version.description: The version number of the Foxx service. The version number must follow the semantic versioning format. This will be shown in the web interface.
